Key Match Events: An 89th-minute goal by substitute Luiz Henrique gave Brazil a 2-1 away win over Chile.
Chile opened the scoring seconds after the kickoff with a header by Eduardo Vargas.
Brazil equalized in added time with a header by Igor Jesus, who replaced the injured Vinicius Júnior.
Post-Match Reflections: Brazil coach Dorival Júnior stated that his team will continue to have ups and downs as he tries out new players.
Henrique expressed the significance of wearing the Brazil shirt and assured fans of their passion and commitment.
Dorival Júnior mentioned that Brazil will have a very strong team in two years, referring to the next World Cup.
